ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Potters] Selling vials
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve heard all sorts of prices for vials.  Regular 1pp-5pp, and Lined 2pp-6pp.  It costs around 6gp for Regular & 1pp for Lined to make.  It is really up to
ygData.messageBody:
I've heard all sorts of prices for vials. Regular 1pp-5pp, and Lined
2pp-6pp. It costs around 6gp for Regular & 1pp for Lined to make. It is
really up to you what you wanna sell them for. I've maxed out this skill so
my prices tend to be on the low side. And I think the high side is kind of
ridiculous if you want to keep any customers. I've found about 3 rogues
that I sell to regularly. When I collect enough zombie skins & think that
I'll make a round of vials I give them a tell and see if they are interested
in buying and find out how many & what kind they want. To find my customers
I usually check /w rogue in the zones and ask high level rogues if they are
interested. The market for vials is so small you'll be wasting your breath
auctioning them over the zones. Though you may pick up an enchanter or two
that way.

Good luck!
Tanana - Bristlebane
Master Brewer, Potter, Beggar


-----Original Message-----
From: Jeanne Mitchell [mailto:Blossom@...]
Sent: April 19, 2000 4:07 AM
To: EQ_Potters@egroups.com
Subject: [EQ_Potters] Selling vials


I am very proud of my little halfling cleric, Feanu. She's only lvl 5
and her pottery skill is up to 96. She can make poison vials, and all
kinds of cooking equipment. She has a full stack of poison vials, and
no one to give them to.

I'd like to auction them - what is a reasonable price to ask? I'm on
the Prexus server.

Speaking of zombie skins - I make regular runs of the markets and
collect quite a lot of skins. All 3 inns (all vendors) will have zombie
skins at various times, the vendors in the tunnel, the Fishing village
of NRo, and the Gypsy camp in Oasis (I only do this in daylight running
very fast). While "shopping" I also pick up specialty meats (gator,
wolf, bear, lion) whenever I see them for hubby's baker.

Thanks for your help.

--
Jeanne Mitchell, Austin, TX
"You can tell the quality of a person by how
they treat people they don't need." My Dad
